info.title: Version 1 of the Micron API
info.description:
## OVERVIEW

Top Performance is a leading-edge performance management software by Micron Systems, the industry leader with more than 25 years of experience providing software specialized for the legal and accounting industries.

Top Performance implements a comprehensive collection of REST (Representational State Transfer) APIs. These APIs allow you to pull data from, add data to, and modify or remove data within Top Performance with precision and ease. Most functionality offered within the application can also be accessed through the APIs.

## FEATURES

* Manage your firm's Maintenance Tables

* Configure Security Roles and Groups

* Import Employee data


**Note:** This documentation is for the v1.0 of the APIs.

## POLICIES

### Deprecation Policy:

The current version of production level APIs is v1. When a new version of APIs is made generally available, the older version will be deprecated and will cease to function after six months. Once an API is removed, any request to it will result in a 404 error.


**Note:** We will not remove any API until similar functionality is present in the new version


### Breaking Change Policy:

Changes that do not break an API, such as adding a new attribute can be made at any time. Changes that break a production level API such as removing attributes or making major changes to the API’s behavior will only be done with an advance notice of 60 days. However, there may be rare occasions where due to legal, performance, or security reasons, we are forced to make breaking changes without advance notice.

## Getting Started

### AUTHENTICATION

The firms who wish to use the Top Performance APIs will be given a client_id and client_secret. These will be provided upon request.
To get an access token to call Top Performance APIs, do a POST call to the below endpoint:
`/oauth/v1/token`

#####Request Parameters in Header:
| Param 	| Description                                   	|
|--------	|-------------------------------------------	|
| `Authorization`   	| The client_id and client_secret must be passed in the authorization header through Basic HTTP authorization. The secret is `Basic Base64Encode(client_id:client_secret`.|
| `Content-Type`   	| Must always be set to `application/x-www-form-urlencoded`.                          	|

#####Request Parameters in Body:
| Param 	| Description                                   	|
|--------	|-------------------------------------------	|
| `grant_type`   	|Required. Must be set to `client_credentials` in the request body. |

Example:

    POST /oauth/v1/token HTTP/1.1
    Host: firm.micronapps.com
    Authorization: Basic MXZiazJxbHVvbmppc3ZlOG1jZ2d2d
    Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
    grant_type=client_credentials

#####Response Parameters in Body:
| Param 	| Description                                   	|
|--------	|-------------------------------------------	|
| `access_token`   	| The access_token parameter to connect with the Top Performance API.|
| `token_type`   	| The token type.                          	|
| `expires_in`   	| The token's life span (default is 3600) in seconds.                          	|

Sample Response:

    HTTP/1.1 200 OK
    Content-Type: application/json
    {
        errors:[],
        fieldErrors:[],
        result:
            {
                access_token:'eyJraWQiOiJUUGFIY3QxcXFIN',
                expires_in: 3600,
                token_type: 'Bearer'
            },
        responseMetadata: null
    }


### API METHODS

Top Performance APIs are plain JSON over HTTPS and use the following HTTPS methods:

| METHOD | PURPOSE |
| --------   | -------------------------------------------    |
| POST | Create an object |
| GET | Fetch one or more objects |
| PUT | Update an object |
| PATCH | Update an object and any references to it |
| DELETE | Remove an object |

### RESPONSES

All response data is returned as a JSON object.See the particular API Endpoint for a description of all the retrievable objects.

### RESPONSE STATUS CODES

Top Performance APIs use the following response status codes, as defined in the RFC 2616 and RFC 6585:


| STATUS CODE |       | DESCRIPTION |
| -------------  | ---    | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------    |
| 200 | | OK: Request completed successfully without errors.                                                    |
| 202 | | Accepted: The request is accepted for processing, but the processing is not complete.				|
| 201 | | Created: Request is complete, and a new resource is created successfully.							|
| 400 | | Bad Request: Request completed with errors.                                                           |
| 401 | | Unauthorized: Request lacks valid authorization credentials.                                      |
| 403 | | Forbidden: User does not have permission to invoke the requested API method.                      |
| 404 | | Not Found: Requested resource was not found, and no other information is available.                   |
| 405 | | Method Not Allowed: The method specified in the request is not allowed.								|
| 409 | | Conflict: The request could not be completed because of a conflict.                                   |
| 415 | | Unsupported Media Type: Request refused because the format or “Content - Type” header was not recognized or accepted by the server. |
| 500 | | Internal Server Error: Generic error code for an internal server error.The request was not completed. The server met an unexpected condition.	|
| 503 |	| Service Unavailable: Server is unable to process your request currently. The request was not completed.The server is temporarily overloading or down.	|

### Response Schema

#### Regular Error Object: 

Apart from the response code, unsuccessful responses return a JSON object containing the following information:

| KEY       | VALUE TYPE 	| VALUE DESCRIPTION                                 	|
|---------	|------------	|---------------------------------------------------	|
| IsValid   | Boolean       | An indicator if the object passed is valid or not     |
| Errors    | -          	| A list of all the errors encountered.                 |
| Field     | string        | A specific field of the error                     	|
| Message   | string        | A short description of the cause of the error.    	|

post.description:
API endpoint: oauth2/v1/token
  • Recommended way to pass the credentials is via Basic HTTP authorization. The client_id and client_secret must be passed in the authorization header through Basic HTTP authorization. The secret is Basic Base64Encode(clientid:clientsecret).
  • The content-type must be set to application/x-www-form-urlencoded.
  • The request body must be set to grant_type=client_credentials.
Note: Access Token will expire after 60 minutes (by default).

Sample Request 1 POST /oauth2/v1/token Authorization: Basic MXZiazJxbHVvbmppc3ZlOG1jZ2d2d Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded Body: grant_type = client_credentials
